turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Push on this side. Alice, this is Jack, Marcie and Ned. Push.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: That's got her. Thanks. I'm Steve Christy. Welcome to Camp Crystal Lake. You got some grubby clothes? Climb into 'em. Alice, see if Bill has cleaned out the boathouse. I want him to start with the canoes. What happened to Brenda?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You told her to sweep the courts.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh, thanks. I wish I could spend more time at it.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I don't know. Probably be best for everybody.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You may not care a lot about this place, Alice, but I mean to make it my whole life. It's been my whole life. Gimme a chance. Stay a week. Help get it ready. Next Friday, if you're not happy, I'll put you on the bus myself. I'll be grateful.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I've got to go to town and pick up the trailer and all that other stuff, but I'll be back around ten. If you're still up, we can talk, okay?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Steve said for you to start on the boats.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Everybody except the girl who's supposed to handle the kitchen. Annie.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You think you're gonna last all summer?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm not sure I'll last all week.  I'll tell Steve.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Steve said you were thinking of leaving. True?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's long and personal. It has nothing to do with you or the other kids.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: And it's this place. It makes no sense, but it spooks me.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You're right. It makes no sense.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I walked into it knowing I'd get hurt, but I thought I could stand anything.  I just wasn't ready for that kind of pain. We were supposed to meet in L.A. When I got back there, he sent a telegram saying he was going back to his wife.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What'll you do when you leave here?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I didn't know I was asleep... What time is it?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You can only do what you can do.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: And then Steve looks at you with those hurt eyes -- like you don't care about children...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: How the... did he get in there?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Slipped in. Probably liked the scent of your perfume.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Bad bulb or no power. It's getting a little gloomy in here.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Jack and Marcie are gonna be drenched.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Not if they're where I think they are.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It wouldn't matter except Steve should be getting back pretty soon. It wouldn't look so great if he fell over them.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Well, it hasn't been that long.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Can't hear anything through that wind and rain.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Did somebody leave the lights on at the softball field?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: It's dead. Try the pay phone.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Do you have a dime? A quarter?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: No. There must be some in the desk somewhere.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Why don't we run? Just run now?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: It's over twenty miles to the crossroads. Steve'll be back in an hour. Things will straighten out then. We'll take his Jeep and get help.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Some campers drowned. Then some counselors got killed.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Don't burn that gorgeous body, or I'll scratch your eyes out...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Ned? We're gonna be working together for a while. You're a nice guy without all the entertainment, okay?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I'm gonna go lie down and catch some z's. Today wiped me out.  Thanks, Alice.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: You know what I said, though.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Come on, Claudette. A man's not made of stone.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I need you so much, Claudette.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: This is almost like the one at my uncle's cabin in Maine.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Don't get up. Take a second...

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I figured if I didn't save you. I'd have to give you mouth-to-mouth and that would have ruined my appetite.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Floor probably leaks. This area is full of springs.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You just had some lucky shots.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Did anyone ever tell you you're beautiful when you're angry?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Want to see my trick shot? It's even better.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: You ever fire one of those bows again, and I'll tack you up on the wall to dry.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: God, but I love that sexy talk.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: What do you want to be when you grow up?

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: We wouldn't want you thinking you're the only show-off in camp, would we?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: No wonder they lost America. How could you sneak around in the bushes wearing that? What's to eat?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Ha! You wily oriental! The phone was "Mr. Watson, come in here, I need you." "What hath God wrought" was the telegraph.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Sometimes I only think about kissing women.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: I was just wondering if you thought there'd by any other gorgeous women at Camp Crystal Lake. Besides yourself.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: What about the dope paragraph in Mr. Christy's letter?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Quote: Controlled substances are expressly forbidden. Possession or use of marijuana or alcohol on campgrounds will means instant dismissal. Unquote.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's gonna be a long summer.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Wait, wait! When I was finding these goodies in the shed. I also found this letter which a camper never sent home. Listen.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Steve taught me how to use the emergency generator. The town power lines are supposed to be real shitty.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: God, but I love that macho talk! Emergency generators! The Indian used campfires.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: Boy, we sure do have a lot of filthy small-minded people around here.  Wait a minute, I'll get my diaphragm and be right with you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wind's up. It's shifted a good hundred and eighty degrees.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: Makes me want to hold on and never let go.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: He keeps on acting like such an asshole!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I thought you wanted to give him one of your motherly lectures. Ned is gonna do whatever he wants to do, you know.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: I'm a little scared of storms. Always have been. Since I was a kid.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: I call it my shower dream.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is no dream. Want to escape for a while?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just a little. Wait a minute, woman.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: Like waves. It's never been likes waves before.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: Gotta pee. You're lying on my bladder.

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: Sex is all you ever think of, Neddy.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Yeah, and it also look like it hasn't seen a coat of paint in six years.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Doctor. Now, if you were a flavor of ice cream, what would you be?

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: Last line of Gone With the Wind?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Frankly, Scarlet, I don't give a damn!

turns.speaker: MARCIE
turns.text: Wait'll you're really in trouble and see what happens...

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: But it's in the brochure! "Camp Crystal Lake has a full drama program." You just saw it.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You can't go back there tonight. Not in that stuff. 'Less you wanta get drownded.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I have six new counsellor up there. They're all babes in the woods in every sense of the word.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: They'll be okay if they know enough to stay in outta the rain.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: How much do I owe you?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: ...I know what you mean. Two and a quarter. Plus fifteen percent tip to make up for me spending the night alone.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Yeah. I got it on before this --  -- all started.

turns.speaker: TIERNEY
turns.text: I told you not to buy that hunk of junk!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I think water got into the electrical system. You ride me back to camp? I'll get one of my counselors to drive me back tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: TIERNEY
turns.text: Bad enough we got a full moon; it's Friday the 13th. They keep statistics. We get more accidents, more robberies, more rapes, more homicides, more of everything when there's a full moon. It affects people. Makes 'em nuts.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You've made a science out of coincidence.

turns.speaker: TIERNEY
turns.text: Have to drop you here, Steve.

turns.speaker: BORDER GUARD
turns.text: What is your purpose in Mexico?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Vacation. I'm taking him to see his first bullfight.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Oh, that's just my daughter in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: BORDER GUARD
turns.text: You said it was just you and your son.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I meant me, my son and my daughter.

turns.speaker: BORDER GUARD
turns.text: Open the door. I'm coming aboard.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Whatsamatter with you? Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Why the fuck, outta all the god forsaken shit holes in Mexico, did you have us rendezvous at that place?

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: I don't know, one place's as good as another.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Have you ever been there before?

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: No, but I passed by it a couple of times. It's out in the middle of nowhere. It seems like a rowdy place, so there wouldn't be a lot of police. And it's open from dusk till dawn. You said meet you in the morning.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Well, because you picked that place out of a hat, my brother's dead now. And this girl's family's dead.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that. What were they, psychos?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Did they look like psychos? They were fuckin' vampires. Psychos don't explode when sunlight hits 'em, I don't care how crazy they are.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Oh, Seth, how can I ever make it up to you?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You can't, but fifteen percent instead of thirty for my stay at El Ray is a good start.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Carlos, my brother's dead and he's not coming back, and it's all your fault. Twenty.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: I said new, this is an '90.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: It's hardly been used at all. I got it from a drug dealer who only drove it 5 times in as many years. Swear to God. That's like new.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: So do I just follow you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: We got about two more hours of day light left. That'll get us into El Paso, which is right next to the border. We'll stop at a motel --

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Stop? We're not going to actually stop at a motel, are we?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Unless you two wiseacres wanna be introduced to the joys of hitchhiking, what say we drop this?

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Why do you want to stop?

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Lie in the back, Dad, I'll drive us into Mexico.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm gonna try and get us across the border.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: No, dad, you gotta tell 'em that they're back there.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Have you forgotten about your sister?

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: They're gonna kill us. They get us across the border, they're gonna take us out in the desert and shoot us.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: If they get over the border, they're gonna let us go.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Dad, I watch those reality shows. They never let anybody go. Any cop will tell you, in a situation like this, you get a chance, you go for it. This is our chance.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: They're gonna kill her anyway. At least now with all these cops we've got a fighting chance.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Son, I have this situation under control. I know exactly what I'm doing. You're going to have to trust me on this.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: If trusting you means trusting those fuckin' killers, I can't do that. If you don't tell the cops, I will.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Now, you listen to me. You ain't gonna do a goddamn fucking thing, you hear me! Nobody cares what you think, I'm running this show, I make the decisions.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm running the show. I make the plays, and you back the plays I make. Stop thinking with your fucking balls. Kate in a room with a couple of desperate men with nothing to fucking lose ain't the time to "go for it." I need your cover. Cover my ass.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's not suicide if you're already dead. Two...

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Okay, I'll kill you when you change, I swear to God in Jesus Christ's name.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Why did they block the door again?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: To keep the daylight out! This is where they sleep! Get to the door!
